commit_message:
Remove data files

Data files are now and should continue to be gleaned from pypowervm,
which should be relied upon to keep them current (with respect to the
REST API), clean, and consolidated.

A recent pypowervm change set has added all the data files needed by
this project, so they are removed from here.

The test utilities used to load these files were also refactored (moved
to a different package).  This change set accomodates that refactor.

Change-Id: I1548ca81d07dbc0f5bf772c426c4d7c3f8d25c65

Removes all po files that are partially translated. The translation
team has decided to exclude files with less than 66 % of translated

'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup of Translations

In preparation for the release, do some cleanups for translations.

Removes all po files that are partially translated. The translation
team has decided to exclude files with less than 66 % of translated
content. There is no content lost, all data is in the translation
server, we just remove it from the repository.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle some of these cases.

Change-Id: Iae315c4f9e030637051722b11aefee9543b335bd

commit_message:
instance:<type> meter is ignored

When specific instance:<type>
(e.g instance:m1.tiny) is defined
in pipeline.yaml, the sample gets discarded because
is_supported method in Source class returns False
this fix prevents the original meter name from
being converted into instance:* before is_supported
is called, so that original meter name can be
checked against value (or pattern) in
pipeline.yaml for a match
This is a stable/kilo only change and cannot be
cherrypicked from master since
instance:<type> meter are no longer supported in
master.

Change-Id: I0b2390f74344c37bf758278668962d0640c7c7ba
Closes-Bug: #1495399

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-27 16:12:52.000000000', 'files': ['saharaclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'print usage when no argument is specified for python3

When running just sahara' under python3, we will get the error:
ERROR: b"'Namespace' object has no attribute 'func'"

This is because map() is used to decode sys.argv, but under Python3
it returns a map object which is an iterable. Some code later tries
to use this in a boolean context and it will always return True,
even if it's empty.

Change-Id: I508b093e30814645b2bd4c32cf469204bb696207
Closes-Bug: #1295356
'}]
commit_message:
print usage when no argument is specified for python3

When running just sahara' under python3, we will get the error:
ERROR: b"'Namespace' object has no attribute 'func'"

This is because map() is used to decode sys.argv, but under Python3
it returns a map object which is an iterable. Some code later tries
to use this in a boolean context and it will always return True,
even if it's empty.

Change-Id: I508b093e30814645b2bd4c32cf469204bb696207
Closes-Bug: #1295356

commit_message:
Make OVS interface name hashing algorithm common and extend it

The OVS devcie name hashing algorithm shortens interface names that are too
long. To ensure uniqueness it takes use of a hashing algorithm.

Move this function to a common place where it can be shared between ml2
drivers and agents.

Extend the function to support interface name postfix in addition to the
prefix.

Change LOG level to info to help deployers figuring out the unhashed name
of an hashed inteface.

Adapt OVS and linuxbridge agent to use this common function instead of their
own implementation.

Change-Id: If7ee8240c8f60da3400365138832a5d9badf98b4
Closes-Bug: #1495960

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-06 00:18:56.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/common/exception.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_task_manager.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_conductor_utils.py', 'ironic/conductor/task_manager.py'], 'message': 'Make node locking pluggable

There are a few changes here:

* Factor out lock acquisition and release to abstract methods in the
  TaskManager class.
* Create a DbTaskManager with the current implementations for lock
  acquisition and release.
* Add a config option to select a TaskManager backend (currently only
  one option - "dbapi").
* Add a TaskManagerNotFound exception in case the task manager backend
  is miconfigured.
* Convert all TaskManager instantiation to use a new get_task_manager
  method that loads the correct backend.
* Force node UUID (not ID) arguments to TaskManager().

Implements: blueprint pluggable-locking
Change-Id: I72b662a47eb7f08e5ea40c2755e9f1f6a27c7ef2
'}]
commit_message:
Make node locking pluggable

There are a few changes here:

* Factor out lock acquisition and release to abstract methods in the
  TaskManager class.
* Create a DbTaskManager with the current implementations for lock
  acquisition and release.
* Add a config option to select a TaskManager backend (currently only
  one option - "dbapi").
* Add a TaskManagerNotFound exception in case the task manager backend
  is miconfigured.
* Convert all TaskManager instantiation to use a new get_task_manager
  method that loads the correct backend.
* Force node UUID (not ID) arguments to TaskManager().

Implements: blueprint pluggable-locking
Change-Id: I72b662a47eb7f08e5ea40c2755e9f1f6a27c7ef2

commit_message:
Allow minimum API version to be configured

This adds a config option for the minimum API version, bounded by
MIN_VER and MAX_VER. If the option is outside of these bounds, it will
be ignored.

This allows deployers to deprecate versions faster than upstream does.

This also pulls in config changes from third-party libraries.

Change-Id: Ic4a6ea1213c5e794d4a6fe9edb63a0fae72683cd

commit_message:

    failed to create hard link /home/stack/ironic-agent.vmlinuz

commit_message:
Fix _create_token_file for noauth mode

In noauth mode, we don't want to depend on keystone. Don't allow any
calls to keystone to validate or renew a fake token if we're in noauth
mode.

Change-Id: Ib144e0b55f12b9f457474b65226f47f530b9a16c
Closes-Bug: #1447658

commit_message:
Initial support to collect node facts like UUID

In order to correctly support a fully name driven inventory,
one where UUIDs have not been supplied and only names have been
provided, we must query ironic after the enrollment of a node to
collect the UUID.

Change-Id: I8f05f8d8aabca4576b81cd73fa0e62c5f5a6f7ea
Depends-On: I23e902c8637e142fba23d71467225d48ee265253
Partial-Bug: #1499057

subject: Allow for bulk edge creation in 'depends_on' nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-14 04:33:45.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/compiler.py'], 'message': "Allow for bulk edge creation in 'depends_on' nodes

Instead of going through each node in u, then going through
each node in v_graph and checking if any depends_on and then
calling into the add edge routine just create a generator function
that will yield back nodes in the v_graph that u provides for.

This allows for the addition of edges into the main graph to
happen in a single pass for each node in u (vs doing it in many
small additions).

Change-Id: Ifc2ed25e9f37060d7d531c73dbf7a36129e55e25
"}]
commit_message:
Allow for bulk edge creation in 'depends_on' nodes

Instead of going through each node in u, then going through
each node in v_graph and checking if any depends_on and then
calling into the add edge routine just create a generator function
that will yield back nodes in the v_graph that u provides for.

This allows for the addition of edges into the main graph to
happen in a single pass for each node in u (vs doing it in many
small additions).

Change-Id: Ifc2ed25e9f37060d7d531c73dbf7a36129e55e25

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-02 19:27:51.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Update flake8 path in tox.ini

The tox.ini pep8 command was running flake8 on the whole repo, however
when also testing the frontend side of the project some of the js
dependencies pull down python code. We don't want to run flake8 on
external code. This commit adjusts the command to only run flake8
on the openstack_health dir which will limit it to our code.

Change-Id: I003e1b87c4990fd09596a222cb506b113eb47abb
"}]
commit_message:
Update flake8 path in tox.ini

The tox.ini pep8 command was running flake8 on the whole repo, however
when also testing the frontend side of the project some of the js
dependencies pull down python code. We don't want to run flake8 on
external code. This commit adjusts the command to only run flake8
on the openstack_health dir which will limit it to our code.

Change-Id: I003e1b87c4990fd09596a222cb506b113eb47abb

commit_message:
copy_puppet_logs: use sudo to rename horizon config

Use sudo to rename horizon config file because the default permissions do not allow it.

Without sudo, the mv fails because of "Permission denied".

Change-Id: Iec7f557c8565c5f70c490a32e1ad1d0ebd39868a

to voting mode.

In saharaclient.api.data_sources.create the description argument is

commit_message:
Make description argument optional

In saharaclient.api.data_sources.create the description argument is
optional. For compatibility reasons the argument order can not be changed
in the method definition. description and the following arguments are now
optional and a validation is added to make sure the method is called
correctly.

Change-Id: I895af9c109d15df16c1ef5d6a6d6bb03a7350dbf
Closes-Bug: 1413578

commit_message:
Revert "Allow display project-id for server groups"

This reverts commit 01c2e60eb3f3718884dd77cb05b4cde76052fb9d

The server side change isn't in yet, there is a spec
proposed:

I167141676ef4f597a1c022c1fd5dc96fd55d02ad

So this should have never landed in the client.  And when
it does it should be using microversions, like we have for
the v2.4 support added in:

5fdb861ad4835513c0cb78251cce85ac73f51dd4

Change-Id: If3196093036c72f0f86cdca98a016b9f4fff0923

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-10-02 22:02:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Ironic: Fix bad capacity reporting if instance_info is unset

If node.instance_info is unset for a node that has an instance on it
(for example, when upgrading Nova from before the patch that set these
values on spawn), the Ironic driver reports 0 for both $resource and
$resource_used. The resource tracker will correct $resource_used, and
resources available will be reported as a negative number.

Correct this by reporting the original value if instance_info is unset.

Closes-Bug: #1502177
Change-Id: I13c5e5430fd305cd0ee2f24cd95304660ccf11eb
'}]
commit_message:
Ironic: Fix bad capacity reporting if instance_info is unset

If node.instance_info is unset for a node that has an instance on it
(for example, when upgrading Nova from before the patch that set these
values on spawn), the Ironic driver reports 0 for both $resource and
$resource_used. The resource tracker will correct $resource_used, and
resources available will be reported as a negative number.

Correct this by reporting the original value if instance_info is unset.

Closes-Bug: #1502177
Change-Id: I13c5e5430fd305cd0ee2f24cd95304660ccf11eb

revisions:
[{'number': 23, 'created': '2015-10-05 08:13:17.000000000', 'files': ['hot/software-config/elements/heat-config-puppet/install.d/hook-puppet.py', 'tests/software_config/test_hook_puppet.py', 'hot/software-config/elements/heat-config/bin/heat-config-notify'], 'message': "Improve handling of Puppet output

Currently the output of Puppet run is written to os-collect-config log only.
If the run gets stuck, we have zero output from it, and have no chance
of guessing where it got stuck. This patch is fixing this issue and also adds
support for running Puppet in debug mode.

Due to big amount of data stdout and stderr in response during debug mode,
both are trimmed so that we won't exceed  max_json_body_size(1048576).

Resolves-bug: rhbz#1242396

Change-Id: Ie92d1714a8d7e59d347474039be999bd3a2b542f
"}]
commit_message:
Improve handling of Puppet output

Currently the output of Puppet run is written to os-collect-config log only.
If the run gets stuck, we have zero output from it, and have no chance
of guessing where it got stuck. This patch is fixing this issue and also adds
support for running Puppet in debug mode.

Due to big amount of data stdout and stderr in response during debug mode,
both are trimmed so that we won't exceed  max_json_body_size(1048576).

Resolves-bug: rhbz#1242396

Change-Id: Ie92d1714a8d7e59d347474039be999bd3a2b542f

commit_message:
Add grafana dashboard for status.o.o/zuul

This is our first grafyaml dashboard which reproduces the current
graphs on status.o.o/zuul rendered by graphite. While we aren't
actually running grafyaml upstream yet, we can get started on building
our dashboards.

We also added a tox job to properly gate on the configuration.

Change-Id: Ia738bcb510e146ab38566f0c13ff483ec618a6ed
Depends-On: I16b9affd4402fe5d1637238a2e27f22fdd3986ff
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Moved api related utils to api module

The sahara.utils module contain a bunch of helpers that are used only
for a specific module or class. The REST API helpers were moved to
sahara.api module where they are used.

Change-Id: Ia682f4624a29cd115f05d607654bce60eecb690c

Added --names --ids arguments which consist of a comma separated
list of names and ids. So the usage is now:
sahara cluster-delete [--name NAME] [--id cluster_id]
                      [--names NAMES] [--ids IDS]
This is a short term solution to delete clusters by list of names
or ids, the long term solution is to have sahara-cli more consitent
with other os clients (like nova delete <server> [<server> ...])
but it implies to refactor the cli. When the refactoring will be
done, we will update this feature.

Partially Implements Blueprint: cli-delete-by-multiple-names-or-ids
Change-Id: I028466679bf776750eb486a1d6dead4c73ffa133
'}]
commit_message:
Add cluster-delete by multiple names or ids

Added --names --ids arguments which consist of a comma separated
list of names and ids. So the usage is now:
sahara cluster-delete [--name NAME] [--id cluster_id]
                      [--names NAMES] [--ids IDS]
This is a short term solution to delete clusters by list of names
or ids, the long term solution is to have sahara-cli more consitent
with other os clients (like nova delete <server> [<server> ...])
but it implies to refactor the cli. When the refactoring will be
done, we will update this feature.

Partially Implements Blueprint: cli-delete-by-multiple-names-or-ids
Change-Id: I028466679bf776750eb486a1d6dead4c73ffa133

commit_message:

Oslo generator is not able to generate glance-serach.conf.

Oslo generator is not supporting glance serach namespaces.

(cherry picked from commit 33e418b8f2d7ae6644f1ee5db97b3fc979923c27)

subject: Parallel discovery in VSCSI (dis)connect_volume
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8190, 'name': 'Drew Thorstensen (thorst)', 'email': 'thorst@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'thorst'}, {'_account_id': 8662, 'name': 'Kyle L. Henderson', 'email': 'kyleh@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kyleh'}, {'_account_id': 12994, 'name': 'Christine Wang', 'email': 'christine911@gmail.com', 'username': 'ijuwang'}, {'_account_id': 13883, 'name': 'Adam Reznechek', 'email': 'adreznec@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'adrez'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 18378, 'name': 'Jeremy Arnold', 'email': 'arnoldje@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'arnoldje'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-05 15:09:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_vscsi.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/vscsi.py'], 'message': "Parallel discovery in VSCSI (dis)connect_volume

To avoid having to use the 'storage' extended attribute group, and thus
slowing down every retrieval and retry, the VSCSI volume driver uses a
separate VIOS GET to perform hdisk discovery for connect_volume and
disconnect_volume.  Previously, this was being done sequentially for all
VIOSes.  Since hdisk discovery is a fairly long-running procedure, we
realize some performance benefit by parallelizing these calls.  This
change set employs a separate local FeedTask to achieve this result.

Change-Id: I69b49cd7eaf1ec9053441750ae75a465f3b66338
Closes-Bug: 1502227
"}]
commit_message:
Parallel discovery in VSCSI (dis)connect_volume

To avoid having to use the 'storage' extended attribute group, and thus
slowing down every retrieval and retry, the VSCSI volume driver uses a
separate VIOS GET to perform hdisk discovery for connect_volume and
disconnect_volume.  Previously, this was being done sequentially for all
VIOSes.  Since hdisk discovery is a fairly long-running procedure, we
realize some performance benefit by parallelizing these calls.  This
change set employs a separate local FeedTask to achieve this result.

Change-Id: I69b49cd7eaf1ec9053441750ae75a465f3b66338
Closes-Bug: 1502227

* Replace dict.values()[0] with list(dict.values())[0]. On Python 3,
  dict.values() returns a view which is not indexable.
* tox.ini: add the following tests to Python 3.4

  - openstack_dashboard.dashboards.identity.users
  - openstack_dashboard.test.api_tests.glance_tests
  - openstack_dashboard.test.api_tests.heat_tests

Partial-Implements: blueprint porting-python3
Change-Id: I68dbe85750399263938b1bf5a342fbb90de83861
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Python 3 issue in horizon DataTable

* Replace dict.values()[0] with list(dict.values())[0]. On Python 3,
  dict.values() returns a view which is not indexable.
* tox.ini: add the following tests to Python 3.4

  - openstack_dashboard.dashboards.identity.users
  - openstack_dashboard.test.api_tests.glance_tests
  - openstack_dashboard.test.api_tests.heat_tests

Partial-Implements: blueprint porting-python3
Change-Id: I68dbe85750399263938b1bf5a342fbb90de83861

commit_message:
Add periodic agents health check.

In addition to periodic checks of L3 and DHCP agents
add periodic checks of overall health of registered agents.
Log total count of agents at debug level so it can be
seen in logs of neutron-server.
In case some agents found dead - log detailed info about them:
Type of agent, last heartbeat, host.

Change-Id: I5db81dad4e9e8325ad3fa3a3e6d5d2d0deb297dd
Closes-Bug: #1453320

The subnet table was joined to the rbac table via an association proxy
which required a bunch of hacking in the model_query setup to get it
to work right.

This patch simplifies it quiet a bit by just using a direct relationship
between the subnets and networkrbacs tables joined via the subnet's
networkid.

It also unrolls an API test that was really difficult to debug because
it was hard to tell which iteration it was on.

Change-Id: I4da85218158aae624835b97053da9fbb6fb154ef
"}]
commit_message:
Simplify join to rbac_entries for subnets

The subnet table was joined to the rbac table via an association proxy
which required a bunch of hacking in the model_query setup to get it
to work right.

This patch simplifies it quiet a bit by just using a direct relationship
between the subnets and networkrbacs tables joined via the subnet's
networkid.

It also unrolls an API test that was really difficult to debug because
it was hard to tell which iteration it was on.

Change-Id: I4da85218158aae624835b97053da9fbb6fb154ef

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-29 21:28:56.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "Fix _ensure_default_security_group logic

In a case when first attempt to fetch default security group
fails and attempt to add it fails too due to a concurrent insertion,
later attempt to fetch the same default sg may fail due to
REPEATABLE READ transaction isolation level.
For this case RetryRequest should be issued to restart the
whole transaction and be able to see default group.

The patch also removes 'while True' logic as it's unsafe

Closes-Bug: #1475938
Change-Id: I20f65d3eae9421429aced1f4586cb6988ab577ff
(cherry-picked from commit 80ee562dec3f397ea6c18a4ca3a1e69ab996341e)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix _ensure_default_security_group logic

In a case when first attempt to fetch default security group
fails and attempt to add it fails too due to a concurrent insertion,
later attempt to fetch the same default sg may fail due to
REPEATABLE READ transaction isolation level.
For this case RetryRequest should be issued to restart the
whole transaction and be able to see default group.

The patch also removes 'while True' logic as it's unsafe

Closes-Bug: #1475938
Change-Id: I20f65d3eae9421429aced1f4586cb6988ab577ff
(cherry-picked from commit 80ee562dec3f397ea6c18a4ca3a1e69ab996341e)

Closes-Bug: #1499877

commit_message:
Check if os-interface extension is present before saving ports

If that extension is not present, then the code to extract and
save ports created during server create by nova will fail.

Change-Id: I6008a0da0c16a34c40e343af4e7237520db4ae36
Closes-Bug: #1499877

commit_message:
Various Documentation Updates

This patch does the following:

- Move the CONTRIBUTING doc content into the developer documentation
- Move the development-stack doc content into the developer documentation
- Rename all instances of 'OpenStack Ansible' to 'OpenStack-Ansible'
- Implements a simpler navigation index for the bottom of the page
- Implements a navigation index at the bottom of all developer docs
- Updates the README to reflect where to get documentation and further
  information
- Adds more information into the 'scripts' developer doc
- Updates the 'Additional Resources' Appendix with Ansible information

Change-Id: Ic08ba072f3b3d1e4e446d1e81c20c0cdf01833de

into the next_nodes set, just update the next_nodes set directly
in the first place.

subject: auth: drop service dependency for Keystone_user_role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-02 20:23:19.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/keystone/auth.pp'], 'message': 'auth: drop service dependency for Keystone_user_role

Drop service dependency for Keystone_user_role.

Without that patch, Ceilometer & Keystone running in WSGI will fail to compile
the catalog because a dependency cycle:
Anchor[keystone_started] => Keystone_user_role[ceilometer@services] =>
Service[ceilometer-api] => Service[httpd] => Anchor[keystone_started]

The dependency is not really useful because it does not prevent the
service to start.

Change-Id: Id8366cd5d2ddf6da468ecc7adb7d55eb8be4c8d8
'}]
commit_message:
auth: drop service dependency for Keystone_user_role

Drop service dependency for Keystone_user_role.

Without that patch, Ceilometer & Keystone running in WSGI will fail to compile
the catalog because a dependency cycle:
Anchor[keystone_started] => Keystone_user_role[ceilometer@services] =>
Service[ceilometer-api] => Service[httpd] => Anchor[keystone_started]

The dependency is not really useful because it does not prevent the
service to start.

Change-Id: Id8366cd5d2ddf6da468ecc7adb7d55eb8be4c8d8

commit_message:
Properly use deployment info in 7.0

In 7.0, default deployment information is returned
for 'ready' nodes and must be used instead of outdated
replaced deployment information.

Closes-bug: 1494507
Closes-bug: 1501728
Change-Id: I545bfabb6c548667464de03fd5aa005d3336002d

commit_message:
Initial security documentation

This documentation explains the security measures which are already in place
in all openstack-ansible deployments. As the security-hardening role grows,
this section will have additional details around the security improvements
within the openstack-ansible project.

Implements: blueprint security-hardening

revisions:

If you use the same server to build several AIOs and rely on teardown.sh
you cannot rely on ssh to log into the containers since old container
names will be present in /etc/hosts

This will also work on multi-node deployements (not just AIOs).

commit_message:
Remove containers from /etc/hosts during teardown

If you use the same server to build several AIOs and rely on teardown.sh
you cannot rely on ssh to log into the containers since old container
names will be present in /etc/hosts

This will also work on multi-node deployements (not just AIOs).

Closes-bug: 1487221
Change-Id: I4931155aaa105762ad752bad43e54a6c3cfe3ae2

commit_message:
Revert "Replace default User model PK"

The orig change introduced this bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/django-openstack-auth/+bug/1499856
and it is not clear how this is fixing an issue.   Proposing we revert this until it can get sorted out.

This reverts commit 8c64de92f4148d85704b10ea1f7bc441db2ddfee.

Closes-bug: #1499856

Change-Id: Iedb4ae1b10d5be733a1fd6ca316f60778f33e2c2

Updates the lint check to ignore templates

This change is needed because some python files being checked
by the flake8 check will have jinja2 expressions within them
which will cause flake syntax failures.

subject: Create experimental grafyaml gate job
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-05 16:38:59.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/infra.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Create experimental grafyaml gate job

Because we are planning on including grafyaml dashboards in
project-config we'll need to properly gate on them.  A follow up patch
will be adding tox -egrafyaml to do just this. Additionally, this job
will only match with tox.ini and the contents of grafana change.

Additionally, the grafyaml dashboards created in the follow up patch
are not actually consumed into production yet.  We still need to add
the puppet logic to handle that.

Change-Id: I497801f2de6dbfcb2b9644bedf361b5fa66463fd
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Create experimental grafyaml gate job

Because we are planning on including grafyaml dashboards in
project-config we'll need to properly gate on them.  A follow up patch
will be adding tox -egrafyaml to do just this. Additionally, this job
will only match with tox.ini and the contents of grafana change.

Additionally, the grafyaml dashboards created in the follow up patch
are not actually consumed into production yet.  We still need to add
the puppet logic to handle that.

Change-Id: I497801f2de6dbfcb2b9644bedf361b5fa66463fd
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix conductor deregistration on non init conductor

Conductor deregistration fails if called on non initialized
conductor, e.g. when AMQP server is unreachable, it raise
Attribute error.

Closes-Bug: 1496017

commit_message:
Add more info level logs to disk_utils.work_on_disk() method

The disk_utils.work_on_disk() is an important method for pxe_* drivers,
so add more info log for debugging helps identify if breaks in the
work_on_disk_method call.

This is a cross-port of Ironic commit:
64943229a802285f3b61c0cb4ca5af2791189978

Change-Id: I466482f7eba812effe6043a0bdb88cc972f37e2e

subject: Remove tuskar from the undercloud install
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-05 15:19:18.000000000', 'files': ['json-files/centos-7-undercloud-packages.json', 'json-files/rhel-7-undercloud-packages.json'], 'message': 'Remove tuskar from the undercloud install

There is currently no liberty tuskar package, so installs using
the latest liberty packages are failing when trying to do
tuskar dbsync. This patch resolves the issue by not installing
tuskar in the undercloud.

An alternative would be to fix the liberty packaging to build
in delorean(https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/249035), but it
seems like we would not want to do this if we are not going
to support tuskar in liberty.

Change-Id: I06e7d399bc1dab167aae67ad335c758cd8dd5ec6
'}]
commit_message:
Remove tuskar from the undercloud install

There is currently no liberty tuskar package, so installs using
the latest liberty packages are failing when trying to do
tuskar dbsync. This patch resolves the issue by not installing
tuskar in the undercloud.

An alternative would be to fix the liberty packaging to build
in delorean(https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/249035), but it
seems like we would not want to do this if we are not going
to support tuskar in liberty.

Change-Id: I06e7d399bc1dab167aae67ad335c758cd8dd5ec6

subject: SQL: Fix event-list with multiple trait query filters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-01 20:13:42.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/functional/api/v2/test_event_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/event/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'SQL: Fix event-list with multiple trait query filters

When querying events with two different *request_id* trait filters, we
expect the response body is an empty, but it may be not. That is because
the multiple trait query filters are not combined correctly.

Change-Id: Id034b01cff891e928625bb0fa668c1ebd7dcf742
Closes-Bug: #1489062
(cherry picked from commit bebfe64575cbede4798b7b5f0c5ef39b725f5092)
'}]
commit_message:
SQL: Fix event-list with multiple trait query filters

When querying events with two different *request_id* trait filters, we
expect the response body is an empty, but it may be not. That is because
the multiple trait query filters are not combined correctly.

Change-Id: Id034b01cff891e928625bb0fa668c1ebd7dcf742
Closes-Bug: #1489062
(cherry picked from commit bebfe64575cbede4798b7b5f0c5ef39b725f5092)

commit_message:
Escape curly braces for awk arguments

I think this was working by accident before. The jjb docs state:

> However, if the macro has parameters, you must escape the { you wish to
> make it through to the output

So now they're escaped.

commit_message:
Allow display project-id for server groups

Currently, the display of server groups doesn't contain informations
about project-id. It is very difficult for admin to tell which
group belongs to which project when using command:
"nova server-group-list --all-projects".

This patch adds project-id to the display.

Change-Id: I010bf02f696396c404bc7a51ce93252c8c7f68a6
Partial-bug:#1481210

subject: wsgi: make sure keystone service is stopped before starting httpd
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-02 20:02:40.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/keystone_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': 'wsgi: make sure keystone service is stopped before starting httpd

When running Keystone in WSGI, we want to make sure Keystone service
(eventlet process) is stopped before starting Apache, otherwise it could
lead to binding issue.

Change-Id: I8b6b0e4900bb64f3878033f96bb24abc07f3646b
'}]
commit_message:
wsgi: make sure keystone service is stopped before starting httpd

When running Keystone in WSGI, we want to make sure Keystone service
(eventlet process) is stopped before starting Apache, otherwise it could
lead to binding issue.

Change-Id: I8b6b0e4900bb64f3878033f96bb24abc07f3646b

commit_message:
Redirect on 303 in SAML plugin

The SAML plugin handles redirects in a custom manner but currently only
checks for the 302 redirect code. This doesn't cover the mod_auth_mellon
case which responds with a 303.

Also handle the 303 redirect case.

Change-Id: Idab5f381fcbfb8c561184845d3aa5c8aab142ecd
Closes-Bug: #1501918
(cherry picked from commit 9cd71c064c77a22a0a58084a2abab77b023017b5)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 20:28:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'nova/utils.py'], 'message': "Change parameter name in utility function

Change b7e9a64416ff239a4c1b8501f398796b02c46ce7 introduced a
filter_deleted flag into the metadata_to_dict utility function.
Counterintuitively, when this flag is False, deleted items are excluded
from the returned dict, and when the flag is True, deleted items are
included.  (The default setting is False, which preserves the behavior
of this function before the flag was added.)  This poor choice of names
doesn't sound like a big deal, but there are some functions calling
metadata_to_dict that are using the flag improperly (that is, they are
setting filter_deleted=True in the expectation that deleted items won't
be included in the output). This patch changes the name of the parameter
to the more perspicuous 'include_deleted', sets the default value to
False to preserve the original behavior of the function, and adds some
tests.  (I'll correct the functions that are using the flag incorrectly
in a dependent patch.)

Change-Id: I40737ebb19fb50e3f671c996a2d096996835cc68
Closes-Bug: #1496394
"}]
commit_message:
Change parameter name in utility function

Change b7e9a64416ff239a4c1b8501f398796b02c46ce7 introduced a
filter_deleted flag into the metadata_to_dict utility function.
Counterintuitively, when this flag is False, deleted items are excluded
from the returned dict, and when the flag is True, deleted items are
included.  (The default setting is False, which preserves the behavior
of this function before the flag was added.)  This poor choice of names
doesn't sound like a big deal, but there are some functions calling
metadata_to_dict that are using the flag improperly (that is, they are
setting filter_deleted=True in the expectation that deleted items won't
be included in the output). This patch changes the name of the parameter
to the more perspicuous 'include_deleted', sets the default value to
False to preserve the original behavior of the function, and adds some
tests.  (I'll correct the functions that are using the flag incorrectly
in a dependent patch.)

Change-Id: I40737ebb19fb50e3f671c996a2d096996835cc68
Closes-Bug: #1496394

When executing "barbican ca list", the client throws an attribute
error if a CA does not contain a meta description field.  This
field is optional.  This fix initializes the _description attribute

Closes-bug: #1502928
'}]
commit_message:
Initialize optional attributes in CA object

When executing "barbican ca list", the client throws an attribute
error if a CA does not contain a meta description field.  This
field is optional.  This fix initializes the _description attribute
to None to prevent the error.

Change-Id: Ic861fe67c59c5109c0f09db46ad229a789d2e510
Closes-bug: #1502928

commit_message:
Fix db_manage to initialize mysql from base

Change the db_manage script to include types when
altering tables and drop constraints before altering tables
because mysql will not allow actions on a table with constraints.

Change-Id: Iafacd662f013cb846bcb3f4ecc50e586e04d55b8
Closes-bug: #1500687
(cherry picked from commit 2333d5c13a5e57bd6c763b1547c143d7f504ccc3)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12817, 'name': 'Sergiy Kulanov', 'email': 'sergey@kulanov.org.ua', 'username': 'skulanov'}, {'_account_id': 13194, 'name': 'Alexei Sheplyakov', 'email': 'asheplyakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asheplyakov'}, {'_account_id': 13505, 'name': 'Igor Belikov', 'email': 'mail@igorbelikov.com', 'username': 'ibelikov'}, {'_account_id': 14689, 'name': 'Vitaly Sedelnik', 'email': 'vitaly.sedelnik@canonical.com', 'username': 'vsedelnik'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2015-08-19 09:41:11.000000000', 'files': ['mirror/centos/yum_repos.mk', 'mirror/centos/repo.mk', 'packages/module.mk', 'requirements-rpm.txt.patch', 'config.mk', 'packages/rpm/module.mk'], 'message': 'Build late artifacts without rebuilding fuel packages

Implement flag PATCHING_CI, which is equal 0, means: patching
feature is disabled.

If PATCHING_CI=1, then:

1) Add 6.1-release mirror [1];
2) Build iso with BUILD_PACKAGES=0
   late packages (fuel-bootstrap-image, fuel-target-centos-images,
   fuel-docker-images) should be always build in spite of
   BUILD_PACKAGES flag, since they are depend on the first level
   artifacts (packages);
3) Update requirements-*.txt files with patching approach since
   we need to store original requirements.txt and be sure that
   building staging mirror will produce the same results as for
   release 6.1;
4) Make sure the release version of bootstrap, centos-image and
   docker packages is increasing.
    We need to be sure that packages (in packages-late target):
     - fuel-bootstrap-image
     - fuel-target-centos-images
     - fuel-docker-images
    will increase their release numbers by 1 continuously
    in order to be able to ship them in updates repositories.

[1]. http://mirror.fuel-infra.org/fwm/6.1-release/

Closes-bug: #1484534

Change-Id: I135136e27040d1663364c3384dea55cf25860a5a
'}]
commit_message:
Build late artifacts without rebuilding fuel packages

Implement flag PATCHING_CI, which is equal 0, means: patching
feature is disabled.

If PATCHING_CI=1, then:

1) Add 6.1-release mirror [1];
2) Build iso with BUILD_PACKAGES=0
   late packages (fuel-bootstrap-image, fuel-target-centos-images,
   fuel-docker-images) should be always build in spite of
   BUILD_PACKAGES flag, since they are depend on the first level
   artifacts (packages);
3) Update requirements-*.txt files with patching approach since
   we need to store original requirements.txt and be sure that
   building staging mirror will produce the same results as for
   release 6.1;
4) Make sure the release version of bootstrap, centos-image and
   docker packages is increasing.
    We need to be sure that packages (in packages-late target):
     - fuel-bootstrap-image
     - fuel-target-centos-images
     - fuel-docker-images
    will increase their release numbers by 1 continuously
    in order to be able to ship them in updates repositories.

[1]. http://mirror.fuel-infra.org/fwm/6.1-release/

Closes-bug: #1484534

Change-Id: I135136e27040d1663364c3384dea55cf25860a5a

subject: Invalidate image cache everytime we make a change
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-04 04:41:02.000000000', 'files': ['shade/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Invalidate image cache everytime we make a change

The image cache is already set up to only cache a steady-state list. If
we simply poke the cache after every time we make an upload or image
change, the existing cache code will cause the cache to stay unfilled
until the new change hits steady state again. This should make turning
on cache do the correct thing.

We want to follow this up with a get bypass of the list, but this should
keep our API counts to a reasonable level.

Change-Id: I47cdfb5af1ba5c56c4005289b9d6b1ecde936978
'}]
commit_message:
Invalidate image cache everytime we make a change

The image cache is already set up to only cache a steady-state list. If
we simply poke the cache after every time we make an upload or image
change, the existing cache code will cause the cache to stay unfilled
until the new change hits steady state again. This should make turning
on cache do the correct thing.

We want to follow this up with a get bypass of the list, but this should
keep our API counts to a reasonable level.

Change-Id: I47cdfb5af1ba5c56c4005289b9d6b1ecde936978

commit_message:
Remove data files

Data files are now and should continue to be gleaned from pypowervm,
which should be relied upon to keep them current (with respect to the
REST API), clean, and consolidated.

A recent pypowervm change set has added all the data files needed by
this project, so they are removed from here.

The test utilities used to load these files were also refactored (moved
to a different package).  This change set accomodates that refactor.

Change-Id: Ic289c0fda3fe8271465f4c66ab99238d880931b3

The commit I4dfbea27ce6c3eecc1a8658b1f9dc0feb2298705 changes
'HostState.metrics' to 'objects.MonitorMetricList'. But MetricWeigher
still use the old dictionary of 'host_manager.MetricItem'. This patch
corrects the behavior of MetricWeigher with related tests, and delete
unused MetricItem.

Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1493680
(cherry picked from commit fd2b868d41a632748939b82ed1b8927adcdfb113)

Fix NoneType error when calling MetricsWeigher

(this is a squashed commit since commit fd2b868 was buggy)
Given that dict comprehensions don't allow to have None as a list, we had
a problem with the Ironic gate-ironic-inspector-dsvm job because
host_state.metrics was set to None by default.

Adding a unittest to make sure we don't regress.

Closes-Bug: #1499271
(cherry picked from commit ccea5d6b0ace535b375d3e63bd572885cb5dbc91)

Change-Id: I9690bc4f6f1dca8f2bf8c5a83f16af6200015506
"}]
commit_message:
Fix MetricWeigher to use MonitorMetricList

The commit I4dfbea27ce6c3eecc1a8658b1f9dc0feb2298705 changes
'HostState.metrics' to 'objects.MonitorMetricList'. But MetricWeigher
still use the old dictionary of 'host_manager.MetricItem'. This patch
corrects the behavior of MetricWeigher with related tests, and delete
unused MetricItem.

Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1493680
(cherry picked from commit fd2b868d41a632748939b82ed1b8927adcdfb113)

Fix NoneType error when calling MetricsWeigher

(this is a squashed commit since commit fd2b868 was buggy)
Given that dict comprehensions don't allow to have None as a list, we had
a problem with the Ironic gate-ironic-inspector-dsvm job because
host_state.metrics was set to None by default.

Adding a unittest to make sure we don't regress.

Closes-Bug: #1499271
(cherry picked from commit ccea5d6b0ace535b375d3e63bd572885cb5dbc91)

Change-Id: I9690bc4f6f1dca8f2bf8c5a83f16af6200015506

subject: Optimize network finding
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-10-04 03:56:58.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/functional/test_floating_ip.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_meta.py', 'shade/meta.py', 'shade/tests/fakes.py', 'shade/__init__.py'], 'message': "Optimize network finding

clarkb was right about the port listing code being unneccesary now
that we have get_external_network. All of the logic that happens there
is also more efficient and easier to override via config. Skip doing
a second pass at ports.

Also, move floating ip finding earlier - if the server has one, that's
the IP it wants - it's the only reason to use one of those.

Change-Id: Ie09c0046aded3646a42cc9714f1fb76375e5e099
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize network finding

clarkb was right about the port listing code being unneccesary now
that we have get_external_network. All of the logic that happens there
is also more efficient and easier to override via config. Skip doing
a second pass at ports.

Also, move floating ip finding earlier - if the server has one, that's
the IP it wants - it's the only reason to use one of those.

Change-Id: Ie09c0046aded3646a42cc9714f1fb76375e5e099

commit_message:
Fix Instance unit test for DBReferenceError

Currently, test_save_objectfield_missing_instance_row isn't reaching
the code where DBReferenceError is handled in Instance.save and the
test is passing because lazy-loading of fields is raising
InstanceNotFound.

This change passes all fields as expected_attrs when creating the
fake Instance object.

Change-Id: I22f504b877007143f2e760f47495f3f9a688e5fb

commit_message:
Align pyngus with oslo.messaging stable

Oslo messaging stable is using pyngus>=1.3,<2 because previous versions
don't work in the gate. This was not picked by the tests because it, for
now, installs that using a different requirements file rather than the
common one.

This commit aligns this requirements with what's in oslo.messaging
stable/kilo in the amqp1-requirements.txt file.

Change-Id: I8b7750c6a5ad06d9a233c58d1e8c2d18e5f63ae5

/usr/share/${project}/rootwrap in filters_path, and consistence is
helpful for distributions.

subject: Adds steps to enable Ubuntu bootstrap feature
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-05 15:48:18.000000000', 'files': ['pages/release-notes/v7-0/new_features/ubuntu_bootstrap.rst', 'pages/operations/enable_ubuntu_bootstrap.rst', 'contents/contents-operations.rst'], 'message': 'Adds steps to enable Ubuntu bootstrap feature

This patch:

- adds instructions how to enable Ubuntu bootstrap experimental
  feature to the Operations guide;
- updates the release note (7.0) about bootstrap (adds a note about
  the default bootstrap OS and add a reference to the Operations
  guide instructions).

commit_message:
Test that microversions are not skipped

When raising API_MAX_VERSION to support a new Nova API microversion
there should be support added to some method to account for the change.
A test has been added to catch if support has not been added.  In the
event that no methods need to change there is an exclusion mechanism in
the test so the version and a note can be added there.

Change-Id: Iebc1be2557e1b6eec327b703568805578e564172

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-01 14:32:29.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_serialization/base64.py', 'README.rst', 'doc/source/api.rst', 'oslo_serialization/tests/test_base64.py'], 'message': 'Add utilities for base64

Writing a code using the base64 module (of the Python standard
library) working on Python 2.7 and 3.4 requires many checks on the
input and/or output type:

* base64.b64encode() only accepts byte string: text must be
  explicitly encoded to ASCII
* base64.b64decode() returns bytes: output must be decoded from UTF-8
  when text is expected

This change adds two pairs of encode/decode functions:

* encode_as_bytes(), decode_as_bytes(): always return the result as
  a byte string
* encode_as_text(), decode_as_text(): always return the result as a
  text string

Encode functions accept text: text is encoded to UTF-8 by default,
but the encoding is configurable.

Decode functions accept text: text is decoded from ASCII.

decode_as_text() decodes the result from UTF-8 by default, but again
the encoding is configurable.


The new submodule is called "base64" to be able to replace:

    import base64

with:

    from oslo_serialization import base64

If the base64 module of the stdlib is needed, it can be imported as a
different name. Example:

    import base64 as std_base64


The encoding example:

    if isinstance(text, six.text_type):
       text = text.encode('utf-8')
    text_b64 = base64.b64encode(text)
    text_b64 = text_b64.decode('ascii')

can be replaced with:

    text_b64 = base64.encode_as_text(text)


The decoding example:

    if isinstance(encoded, six.text_type):
       encoded = encoded.decode('ascii')
    text = base64.b64decode(encoded)
    text = text.decode('utf-8')

can be replaced with:

    text = base64.decode_as_text(text)

Change-Id: Icf8df9c947bc0c5f4838508b756ed8f53efd9fc4
'}]
commit_message:
Add utilities for base64

Writing a code using the base64 module (of the Python standard
library) working on Python 2.7 and 3.4 requires many checks on the
input and/or output type:

* base64.b64encode() only accepts byte string: text must be
  explicitly encoded to ASCII
* base64.b64decode() returns bytes: output must be decoded from UTF-8
  when text is expected

This change adds two pairs of encode/decode functions:

* encode_as_bytes(), decode_as_bytes(): always return the result as
  a byte string
* encode_as_text(), decode_as_text(): always return the result as a
  text string

Encode functions accept text: text is encoded to UTF-8 by default,
but the encoding is configurable.

Decode functions accept text: text is decoded from ASCII.

decode_as_text() decodes the result from UTF-8 by default, but again
the encoding is configurable.


The new submodule is called "base64" to be able to replace:

    import base64

with:

    from oslo_serialization import base64

If the base64 module of the stdlib is needed, it can be imported as a
different name. Example:

    import base64 as std_base64


The encoding example:

    if isinstance(text, six.text_type):
       text = text.encode('utf-8')
    text_b64 = base64.b64encode(text)
    text_b64 = text_b64.decode('ascii')

can be replaced with:

    text_b64 = base64.encode_as_text(text)


The decoding example:

    if isinstance(encoded, six.text_type):
       encoded = encoded.decode('ascii')
    text = base64.b64decode(encoded)
    text = text.decode('utf-8')

can be replaced with:

    text = base64.decode_as_text(text)

Change-Id: Icf8df9c947bc0c5f4838508b756ed8f53efd9fc4

commit_message:
Ensure token validation works irrespective of padding

In change I674bad86ccc9027ac3b365c10b3b142fc9d73c17 we removed the padding from
Fernet tokens. This commit makes it so that we can validate Fernet tokens that
come in with and without padding. This change will only effect Kilo and
Liberty.

Change-Id: Id5d2305b57f29823ef491d7cc9fd541a2d66ea84
Partial-Bug: 1491926

commit_message:
Fix db_manage to initialize mysql from base

Change the db_manage script to include types when
altering tables and drop constraints before altering tables
because mysql will not allow actions on a table with constraints.

Change-Id: Iafacd662f013cb846bcb3f4ecc50e586e04d55b8
Closes-bug: #1500687

subject: Update Project Quotas design spec
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-18 22:38:11.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/quota-support-for-barbican-resources.rst'], 'message': 'Update Project Quotas design spec

Upon discovery and discussion, this commit brings three changes to the
design spec for project quotas.

1) Removal of quota support for transport keys.  It turns out they
   are not a project resource and should not be managed on a per
   project basis.
2) New role for quota management.  The management of project quotas
   can not fall to project level admins.  This must be the responsibility
   of a service level admin.  A new keystone role is introduced to
   implement this change.
3) Clarification of paging support.  The examples are updated to clarify
   the paging support to be implemented for listing project quotas.

Change-Id: I4d5fb76e2868f63f623a8a3cd0b14d0bba31290a
Relates-to: blueprint quota-support-on-barbican-resources
'}]
commit_message:
Update Project Quotas design spec

Upon discovery and discussion, this commit brings three changes to the
design spec for project quotas.

1) Removal of quota support for transport keys.  It turns out they
   are not a project resource and should not be managed on a per
   project basis.
2) New role for quota management.  The management of project quotas
   can not fall to project level admins.  This must be the responsibility
   of a service level admin.  A new keystone role is introduced to
   implement this change.
3) Clarification of paging support.  The examples are updated to clarify
   the paging support to be implemented for listing project quotas.

Change-Id: I4d5fb76e2868f63f623a8a3cd0b14d0bba31290a
Relates-to: blueprint quota-support-on-barbican-resources

subject: Add maas external check for neutron metadata proxy
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-02 22:49:50.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/raxmon_agent.yml', 'rpc_deployment/playbooks/monitoring/maas_local.yml'], 'message': "Add maas external check for neutron metadata proxy

The neutron metadata agent proxy provides access from within neutron
network namespaces to the neutron metadata agent and thus to the
various sources of metadata provided to instances on 169.254.169.254
at port 80 when cloud-init is used.

The metadata agent has monitoring in RPC but has been reported to be
running but non-responsive on some occasions (see issue #342). The
new check tests the agent's proxy from within the namespace to
monitor responsiveness. Because the agent will use the client host
IP to look for metadata but the request is not originating from an
instance a 404 Not Found response is expected from the agent.

Because local checks are expected to operate from the host rather
than inside a container, and the host does not have ready access to
neutron network namespaces, the monitor must probe for an appropriate
container and resorts to executing a curl request through the network
namespace within the selected container for each network that is
expected to be proxied (only those networks which have ports). This is
deemed easier to verify and understand through command shell
operations than alternative solutions.

This solution seems to work regardless of the value of OSA's
nova_force_config_drive setting or the use of the config-drive feature
in Nova.

backport of https://github.com/rcbops/rpc-openstack/commit/3c598136208610e99e65d2ef495925c4ade209de

Change-Id: Ic85f3f98ce3dfe3295f6710457c64bee6349425d
Closes-Bug: 1502240
"}]
commit_message:
Add maas external check for neutron metadata proxy

The neutron metadata agent proxy provides access from within neutron
network namespaces to the neutron metadata agent and thus to the
various sources of metadata provided to instances on 169.254.169.254
at port 80 when cloud-init is used.

The metadata agent has monitoring in RPC but has been reported to be
running but non-responsive on some occasions (see issue #342). The
new check tests the agent's proxy from within the namespace to
monitor responsiveness. Because the agent will use the client host
IP to look for metadata but the request is not originating from an
instance a 404 Not Found response is expected from the agent.

Because local checks are expected to operate from the host rather
than inside a container, and the host does not have ready access to
neutron network namespaces, the monitor must probe for an appropriate
container and resorts to executing a curl request through the network
namespace within the selected container for each network that is
expected to be proxied (only those networks which have ports). This is
deemed easier to verify and understand through command shell
operations than alternative solutions.

This solution seems to work regardless of the value of OSA's
nova_force_config_drive setting or the use of the config-drive feature
in Nova.

backport of https://github.com/rcbops/rpc-openstack/commit/3c598136208610e99e65d2ef495925c4ade209de

Change-Id: Ic85f3f98ce3dfe3295f6710457c64bee6349425d
Closes-Bug: 1502240

commit_message:
Add --metadata as optional input when do nova image-create

Currently, when using nova image-create, we are not able to
input metadata for the snapshot, and it is always set to be
None.

This patch add --metadata as an optional input when calling
nova image-create.

Change-Id: Ic72dc3652a77cfad099e144423302042a47f6e1e
Closes-bug: #1500727

commit_message:
Add pep8 check for assertEqual argument order

There is a lot of patches for fixing assertEqual argument order,
and it's not so productive at all. For avoiding creating/reviewing
this kind of patches in the future, this patch adds pep8 check.

black_list which are against this rule are separated to multiple
files because some people are trying to fix this problem on the
gerrit and it is good to avoid merger conflicts for efficient work.
These works are managed on
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-assert-equal-argument-order-fix

Change-Id: I99636b1aba99a5b9343af0c56426775c26ddd679
Depends-on: I01f9caa083dc7d06c850c9f466a6b38fbd42d209
Related-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
Tag the alembic migration revisions for Liberty

Previously when we had one repo with one alembic branch we would
create a milestone revision on that single branch. Now we have
multiple repos and expand/contract branches for each repo.

So from now on we tag the final revision on every branch when we make
a milestone release. Update the cli to support the command:
  neutron-db-manage upgrade <milestone>
where <milestone> becomes an alias for all the revisions for a
milestone.

Closes-Bug: #1499033

Change-Id: I38623986dd574bec01fe147f9c6a747f3f512bb7
(cherry picked from commit 52236764a3a7c23ec24a86ccb84bc6737e2a4791)
Conflicts:
        neutron/db/migration/cli.py
	neutron/tests/unit/db/test_migration.py

subject: py3: Fix "tox -e py34"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-29 13:17:01.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/workbook/parser.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/test_coordination.py', 'mistral/expressions.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'py3: Fix "tox -e py34"

Add a py34 test environment to tox.ini which runs a subset of tests
on Python 3.4. When "tox -e py34" will pass, it will become possible
to make the python34 check job voting to avoid Python 3 regressions.
Then slowly more and more tests will be ported to Python 3.

Port also some unit tests to Python 3:

* expressions.py: The message attribute of exceptions has been
  removed in Python 3, use six.text_type(exc) instead.
* test_coordination: fix Unicode versus bytes issues, use byte
  strings for members
* parsers.py: get StringIO from six.

Change-Id: Ib65ed97666919abcfb01a758ed1bcc73b6c0758d
'}]
commit_message:
py3: Fix "tox -e py34"

Add a py34 test environment to tox.ini which runs a subset of tests
on Python 3.4. When "tox -e py34" will pass, it will become possible
to make the python34 check job voting to avoid Python 3 regressions.
Then slowly more and more tests will be ported to Python 3.

Port also some unit tests to Python 3:

* expressions.py: The message attribute of exceptions has been
  removed in Python 3, use six.text_type(exc) instead.
* test_coordination: fix Unicode versus bytes issues, use byte
  strings for members
* parsers.py: get StringIO from six.

Change-Id: Ib65ed97666919abcfb01a758ed1bcc73b6c0758d

commit_message:
Update python-muranoclient to 0.7.1

During RC cycle testing we discovered critical bug resulting in
failed application deployment for any Heat-based package which
was fixed in python-muranoclient v0.7.1.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-30 06:44:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Fix quota update in init_instance on nova-compute restart

During instance deletion if nova-compute crashes after setting
instance vm_state to 'DELETED' but before destroying instance from db,
then on restart of nova-compute _init_instance method deletes instance
from db as well but fails to update quota for that instance.

Since on nova-compute restart that instance was marked as deleted in
db also, quota for that instance never gets updated.

Added code to get instance metadata in init_host as it is required in
'notify_about_instance_usage' method and getting instance
system_metadata before destroying instance from db
in _complete_partial_deletion.

Closes-Bug: 1493694
Change-Id: Ib4ff381848957b33774a4d7c1bfcf1410d67a657
(cherry picked from commit fdd85c10de35c21700dd33bb9b2e0a3ff425d83a)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix quota update in init_instance on nova-compute restart

During instance deletion if nova-compute crashes after setting
instance vm_state to 'DELETED' but before destroying instance from db,
then on restart of nova-compute _init_instance method deletes instance
from db as well but fails to update quota for that instance.

Since on nova-compute restart that instance was marked as deleted in
db also, quota for that instance never gets updated.

Added code to get instance metadata in init_host as it is required in
'notify_about_instance_usage' method and getting instance
system_metadata before destroying instance from db
in _complete_partial_deletion.

Closes-Bug: 1493694
Change-Id: Ib4ff381848957b33774a4d7c1bfcf1410d67a657
(cherry picked from commit fdd85c10de35c21700dd33bb9b2e0a3ff425d83a)

subject: Port common.utils to Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-16 23:38:40.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'glance/common/utils.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Port common.utils to Python 3

* CooperativeReader: buffer is a byte string, use b'' syntax
  and use bytes() instead of str().
* Don't compare None to int, it raises a TypeError on Python 3.
* Use str[i:i+1] to get a substring from a byte string. On Python 3,
  str[i] now returns an integer for byte strings.
* tox.ini: add glance.tests.unit.common.test_utils to Python 3.4

Change-Id: Ie678555ffd8ac48913f9bf08ac674d1c643bec29
"}]
commit_message:
Port common.utils to Python 3

* CooperativeReader: buffer is a byte string, use b'' syntax
  and use bytes() instead of str().
* Don't compare None to int, it raises a TypeError on Python 3.
* Use str[i:i+1] to get a substring from a byte string. On Python 3,
  str[i] now returns an integer for byte strings.
* tox.ini: add glance.tests.unit.common.test_utils to Python 3.4

Change-Id: Ie678555ffd8ac48913f9bf08ac674d1c643bec29

commit_message:
Modify 'render_to_file' function to make it operate on unicode objects

If we have non-ascii chars in rendered template we might end up with
UnicodeDecodeError exception when writing the content to a file. To
eliminate this issue io.open is used with additional 'encoding'
parameter

Change-Id: I73ee352a439d7a9d5c71033f31530a0ced68324c
Closes-Bug: #1475234

before hashing.

* StoreLocations: add a __eq__() method, Python 3 doesn't use __cmp__()

  for "del locations[a:b]" instead of calling __delslice__().

Change-Id: Ibe8dac3d442ee08ae6b347e256947b6b9c5224ae

commit_message:
Port store image to Python 3

* StoreLocations: add a __eq__() method, Python 3 doesn't use __cmp__()
  anymore
* Fix StoreLocations.__delitem__(): Python 3 now calls it with a slice
  for "del locations[a:b]" instead of calling __delslice__().
* Fix test_store_location: mark byte strinsg with b'...' prefix.
* tox.ini: add test_store_location to Python 3.4

Change-Id: Ibe8dac3d442ee08ae6b347e256947b6b9c5224ae

subject: Port replicator to Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-16 23:38:40.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/test_glance_replicator.py', 'glance/tests/unit/utils.py', 'glance/cmd/replicator.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Port replicator to Python 3

* replication_dump(): explicit the JSON encoding (UTF-8) to not rely on
  the locale encoding, otherwise the function will fail on non-ASCII
  character if the locale encoding is ASCII (ex: POSIX locale aka "C")
* Use sorted() to get the sorted list of keys. dict.keys() returns a
  generator on Python 3 which has no sort() method.
* Fix FakeImageService: HTTP body is bytes
* utils.py: get the urllib module from six.moves
* tox.ini: add test_glance_replicator to Python 3.4

Change-Id: Iaded283c70f49abb2408565563c173f58fff2fc7
'}]
commit_message:
Port replicator to Python 3

* replication_dump(): explicit the JSON encoding (UTF-8) to not rely on
  the locale encoding, otherwise the function will fail on non-ASCII
  character if the locale encoding is ASCII (ex: POSIX locale aka "C")
* Use sorted() to get the sorted list of keys. dict.keys() returns a
  generator on Python 3 which has no sort() method.
* Fix FakeImageService: HTTP body is bytes
* utils.py: get the urllib module from six.moves
* tox.ini: add test_glance_replicator to Python 3.4

Change-Id: Iaded283c70f49abb2408565563c173f58fff2fc7

commit_message:
Improve readability of dockerfiles and cleanup

* Added newlines to long RUN commands in dockerfiles.
* Removed storage-* containers (obsolete since 6.0)
* Removed shotgun workaround in mcollective container.
* Cleaned up duplicate packages already included in
  fuel/centos base container.
* Moved hiera default yaml workaround to fuel/centos

Change-Id: I1ed33c6df5a5dcac2c0861e08d36184d9a8c2c2d

commit_message:
Implement get_boot_device for seamicro driver

Implement get_boot_device for seamicro driver to get current boot
device for the task's node and its persistent state, whether the
boot device will persist to all future boots or not.

Change-Id: I49d0e45d56d9ceb373fc430ff184f963b6275ca2
Closes-bug: 1407888

subject: Change ironic-python-agent release model
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-01 15:50:02.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Change ironic-python-agent release model

Historically, ironic-python-agent has always recommended deploying from
master branch. However, we realize that actual releases and stable
branches bring value to some folks. So, this commit:

* makes IPA managed by the release team
* makes IPA do intermediary releases with a coordinated cycle release
* makes IPA do stable branches

Change-Id: I04a8242692831a054430f763414c3a38cba46617
'}]
commit_message:
Change ironic-python-agent release model

Historically, ironic-python-agent has always recommended deploying from
master branch. However, we realize that actual releases and stable
branches bring value to some folks. So, this commit:

* makes IPA managed by the release team
* makes IPA do intermediary releases with a coordinated cycle release
* makes IPA do stable branches

Change-Id: I04a8242692831a054430f763414c3a38cba46617

commit_message:
Stop setting DIB_EXTLINUX for vanilla/centos7

Remove the setting of DIB_EXTLINUX for vanilla/centos7, as it now builds
fine with recent diskimage-builder versions.

This partially reverts commit 53627f187b94c7355ff0640d68b323790536475d
(the other half of it has already been reverted with commit
2fb3c7e2e86beff2db60bb3bd3c10d7eb547f151).

Change-Id: Ib5b72c7b4e40466ffd59e321c8a59dc7a41b0306

In preparation for the release, do some cleanups for translations.

Removes all po files that are partially translated. The translation
team has decided to exclude files with less than 66 % of translated
content. There is no content lost, all data is in the translation
server, we just remove it from the repository.

This updates also recreates pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository in case there was no recent
import for them.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle some of these cases.

Change-Id: I9616eb5e756f694b55cadb57b7b2aacf46833bb9
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup of Translations

In preparation for the release, do some cleanups for translations.

Removes all po files that are partially translated. The translation
team has decided to exclude files with less than 66 % of translated
content. There is no content lost, all data is in the translation
server, we just remove it from the repository.

This updates also recreates pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository in case there was no recent
import for them.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle some of these cases.

Change-Id: I9616eb5e756f694b55cadb57b7b2aacf46833bb9

commit_message:
Functional tests: optionally skip admin actions in setups

* This defaults to doing those admin actions
* This lets us run a set of smoke tests without need admin access
* Fix a url to respect the `append_version_to_url` config option
* Also, move configs like this into a separate config section

Change-Id: If159423906d979990264fd8fd47b47e37aafe6ed

nailgun from 8 to 24.

commit_message:
Allow releasing fuel-dev-tools to PyPi

fuel-dev-tools is a useful package for ones who are
testing something on a live Fuel environment or troublesooting
a problem. In order to make it more useful, it's necessary
to publish it on PyPi.

This patch adds publish-to-pypi template to fuel-dev-tools
project.

Change-Id: I56916bac4fc3aee2247ee2337836cb128cd3c018

commit_message:
Clean up instance specific informantion on tear down

After sucessfully tearing down a node some information about the previous
instance are still shown to the user. Things like the root UUID of the
last image's filesystem and whether it was a full disk image or not. Those
information should be cleaned up.

Apparently only the PXE driver was leaving such informations.

Closes-Bug: #1451885
Change-Id: Ice9926bbbb93d2ecf8ac1c70fcd78b7e8b76bf22

commit_message:
Change remote logging configuration condition

We'll have new 'enabled' meta parameter in 'syslog' hash. So it
would be better to use it in remote logging conditions.

Requires: I0190c202a72f432c23c71b9ebea88bc01476d2ee

Change-Id: Id4b8cd47bd27bbc7224a3258b5b5388b89496e35
Partial-bug: #1418848

subject: (WIP)Add user/project information to Ceilometer Event Model
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-29 12:29:40.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/pipeline.py', 'ceilometer/event/storage/pymongo_base.py', 'ceilometer/dispatcher/database.py', 'ceilometer/event/converter.py', 'ceilometer/event/storage/models.py', 'ceilometer/event/storage/impl_elasticsearch.py', 'ceilometer/event/storage/impl_hbase.py', 'ceilometer/event/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/events.py', 'ceilometer/api/rbac.py'], 'message': '(WIP)Add user/project information to Ceilometer Event Model

The current Event object schema does not define user or
project information related to an event. Due to this
ownership information related to an event can never be
established. This interferes with applying Role Based
Access Control related rules on an Event (basically
means that rules cannot be defined in the policy.json).
Associating user/project information with an Event might
not be too significant a requirement when it comes to
common events, but this becomes a critical need when it
comes to audit-related events.

Partially Closes-Bug: 1461767

Change-Id: I108acdff6ef4b8ea4733debef666b46559a42682
'}]
commit_message:
(WIP)Add user/project information to Ceilometer Event Model

The current Event object schema does not define user or
project information related to an event. Due to this
ownership information related to an event can never be
established. This interferes with applying Role Based
Access Control related rules on an Event (basically
means that rules cannot be defined in the policy.json).
Associating user/project information with an Event might
not be too significant a requirement when it comes to
common events, but this becomes a critical need when it
comes to audit-related events.

Partially Closes-Bug: 1461767

Change-Id: I108acdff6ef4b8ea4733debef666b46559a42682

subject: file backend: do not inherit from glance::api
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-02 21:15:23.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/glance_backend_file_spec.rb', 'manifests/backend/file.pp', 'spec/acceptance/basic_glance_spec.rb'], 'message': "file backend: do not inherit from glance::api

Do not make ::glance::backend::file inherits from ::glance::api because
::glance::api has parameters.
The class was broken until now.

Also, we need to include glance::backend::file to have
'filesystem_store_datadir' parameter in Glance config, since we're using
file backend.

If you don't provide this parameter, Glance fails to start:
glance_store._drivers.filesystem [-] Specify at least
'filesystem_store_datadir' or 'filesystem_store_datadirs' option

Change-Id: Iba6791199f7a2c7fef24b1e8752ed0b564b8512f
"}]
commit_message:
file backend: do not inherit from glance::api

Do not make ::glance::backend::file inherits from ::glance::api because
::glance::api has parameters.
The class was broken until now.

Also, we need to include glance::backend::file to have
'filesystem_store_datadir' parameter in Glance config, since we're using
file backend.

If you don't provide this parameter, Glance fails to start:
glance_store._drivers.filesystem [-] Specify at least
'filesystem_store_datadir' or 'filesystem_store_datadirs' option

Change-Id: Iba6791199f7a2c7fef24b1e8752ed0b564b8512f

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

At some places, corrected argument order for assertNotEqual method as well
and replaced assertEqual with assertTrue/assertFalse wherever required. Also
renamed params passed to assertEqual method to avoid confusion for developers.

Partial-Bug: #1259292
Change-Id: I0809fd6e0f505d7a80a354614900803f12b2eaa8

commit_message:
Change release model for networking-ovn

This plugin is far enough along that as of the Mitaka release cycle, I'd
like to start doing releases in line with the OpenStack release cycle so
that this plugin does releases at the same time as the core of Neutron.

Change-Id: I6e83106319135ebfc88fb3fd59e54be6b4db4a6b
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-01 10:37:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/cloudbyte/cloudbyte.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_cloudbyte.py'], 'message': 'Setup error check & minor bug fix in CloudByte

Currently in CloudByte Cinder driver there is now way of checking
the "absence" or "validity" of configuration parameters, which are
configured by clients during DevStack setup against CloudByte
Storage in "cinder.conf". In this case the cinder-volume service
initializes the driver with the parameters either not present or are
invalid, and due to this several ambiguity happens at client-end, like:

* Volume related operation failure.
* No proper detection of the cause of failure.

So, to rectify this problem "check_for_setup_error" method is added
which will check the absence and validity of config parameters and
will not initialize the driver until the cause is rectified.

Also, another minor bug fixed is done which allows the volume
deletion operation to continue from OpenStack even if the volume has
been deleted from CloudByte Storage.

Change-Id: Ia23aac3ecf7f706ab39ddef51fb5494df6d4d0dd
Closes-Bug: #1501304
'}]
commit_message:
Setup error check & minor bug fix in CloudByte

Currently in CloudByte Cinder driver there is now way of checking
the "absence" or "validity" of configuration parameters, which are
configured by clients during DevStack setup against CloudByte
Storage in "cinder.conf". In this case the cinder-volume service
initializes the driver with the parameters either not present or are
invalid, and due to this several ambiguity happens at client-end, like:

* Volume related operation failure.
* No proper detection of the cause of failure.

So, to rectify this problem "check_for_setup_error" method is added
which will check the absence and validity of config parameters and
will not initialize the driver until the cause is rectified.

Also, another minor bug fixed is done which allows the volume
deletion operation to continue from OpenStack even if the volume has
been deleted from CloudByte Storage.

Change-Id: Ia23aac3ecf7f706ab39ddef51fb5494df6d4d0dd
Closes-Bug: #1501304

commit_message:
workload: fix custom_image cleanup

A VM ran by `custom_image` context is left running in case the script
failed. Fix this by moving cleanup to a try/finally block letting
the exception propagate upwards so no scenario is run when the context
have failed.

Change-Id: I90d783eeb50b1f0bfa77d59993ff116451d11878
Closes-Bug: #1502832

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-16 16:33:37.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/parser/functions/service_default.rb', 'spec/functions/service_default_spec.rb'], 'message': "Create service_default function

This change creates a parser function that can be used in place of the
string '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' for class parameters or anywhere someone
would want to specify the string within puppet code.

Things like:
 class openstack::class (
    $param_user = '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
    $param_pass = '<SERVICE DEFAULT>') { ... }

Can be replaced with:
  class openstack::class (
    $param_user = service_default(),
    $param_pass = service_default()) { ...  }

Leveraging this function instead of the constant use '<SERVICE DEFAULT>'
allows for easy refactoring and reduces the posibility for typos to make
it past reviews. Ideally it would be awesome if we could create our own
custom puppet reserved word or a constant but since you cannot do this,
a parser function allows for similar functionality.

Change-Id: Ic0665485d855225aaa522074e4505d704b0c513b
"}]
commit_message:
Create service_default function

This change creates a parser function that can be used in place of the
string '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' for class parameters or anywhere someone
would want to specify the string within puppet code.

Things like:
 class openstack::class (
    $param_user = '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
    $param_pass = '<SERVICE DEFAULT>') { ... }

Can be replaced with:
  class openstack::class (
    $param_user = service_default(),
    $param_pass = service_default()) { ...  }

Leveraging this function instead of the constant use '<SERVICE DEFAULT>'
allows for easy refactoring and reduces the posibility for typos to make
it past reviews. Ideally it would be awesome if we could create our own
custom puppet reserved word or a constant but since you cannot do this,
a parser function allows for similar functionality.

Change-Id: Ic0665485d855225aaa522074e4505d704b0c513b

This change adds a custom fact called os_service_default, for use with
the openstack modules to provide the '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' string for
configurations.

Static external facts can be loaded from <MODULEPATH>/<MODULE>/facts.d/
starting with Puppet 3.4/Facter 2.0.1. Prior to this change, the static

Change-Id: Id6eec6f96d545bb0054aad30bf359cf32521c83a
"}]
commit_message:
Add os_service_default fact

This change adds a custom fact called os_service_default, for use with
the openstack modules to provide the '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' string for
configurations.

Static external facts can be loaded from <MODULEPATH>/<MODULE>/facts.d/
starting with Puppet 3.4/Facter 2.0.1. Prior to this change, the static
facts needed to be placed in an environment specific location. For
Facter < 2.0.1, we are providing a regular ruby fact.

Change-Id: Id6eec6f96d545bb0054aad30bf359cf32521c83a

commit_message:
Just call set-manager if connecting fails

Instead of calling set-manager every init, only call it when
getting the schema fails inside of Connection.start() which is
only called once.

Closes-Bug: #1499784
Change-Id: Ib28cd912e1f2eba318a6b0a82269919a1c95312d
(cherry picked from commit c561c7c20acef7227e2eab2be30a2626e16d2354)

subject: Live HTML builds for documentation edits
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-29 14:11:23.000000000', 'files': ['doc/Makefile', 'dev-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Live HTML builds for documentation edits

Editing documentation and running 'make html' after each edit can be tedious.
This patch adds automatic build support that will watch the docs directories
for any changes, and then build documentation when changes are saved to disk.

The writer can then refresh their browser and see the latest content without
needing to run 'make html' after each edit.

Closes-Bug: 1500897

Change-Id: I29a36d29a7eef85bb275fe1a474b51aa97e7990e
"}]
commit_message:
Live HTML builds for documentation edits

Editing documentation and running 'make html' after each edit can be tedious.
This patch adds automatic build support that will watch the docs directories
for any changes, and then build documentation when changes are saved to disk.

The writer can then refresh their browser and see the latest content without
needing to run 'make html' after each edit.

Closes-Bug: 1500897

Change-Id: I29a36d29a7eef85bb275fe1a474b51aa97e7990e

VMs were able to issue ICMP Router Solicitations requests but answers

commit_message:
Add Router-Advertisements to inbound icmp-types

VMs were able to issue ICMP Router Solicitations requests but answers
were always blocked. Users had to manually create rules in
security-groups to receive a default route.

This commit allows inbound router-advertisements by default.

Change-Id: Ieae04fc43300e6a0a84942534e75173f3ae24a2f
